security_audit.summary: All 19 static findings are false positives. The scanner flagged benign metadata (GitHub URL, sha256 hashes), common English words in skill name (review/reviewer), and code examples showing SQL injection vulnerabilities as security issues. The skill is a legitimate code review assistant that provides guidance on code quality, security, performance, and best practices. No malicious behavior detected.

content.user_title: Review code for quality and security
content.value_statement: Manual code reviews are time-consuming and inconsistent. This skill provides systematic, thorough code review guidance following industry best practices for code quality, security vulnerabilities, performance issues, and maintainability.
actual_capabilities: Analyzes code for readability, naming conventions, and complexity issues
Reviews code for security vulnerabilities including SQL injection and XSS
Evaluates performance concerns like algorithmic complexity and N+1 queries
Checks adherence to language-specific idioms and design patterns
Provides actionable recommendations with code examples
Reviews test coverage and documentation completeness
limitations: Does not execute or run code - only analyzes source code text
Cannot access external systems or APIs for integration testing
Does not modify code directly - only suggests improvements
Limited to pattern recognition - may miss domain-specific bugs

use_cases.title: Pull Request Reviews
use_cases.description: Systematically review pull requests before merge to catch issues early and maintain code quality standards across the team.

use_cases.title: Learning and Mentoring
use_cases.description: Help junior developers understand best practices by explaining why certain patterns are problematic and how to improve them.

use_cases.title: Security Audits
use_cases.description: Identify security vulnerabilities in code such as injection flaws, authentication issues, and sensitive data exposure.

<code_to_review>

output: The code uses string formatting to construct the SQL query, which allows attackers to manipulate the query through the user_id parameter.
**Why this is safer:** Using parameterized queries ensures user input is treated as data, not executable SQL code.
The function has nested conditionals that make it hard to read and maintain. Consider using guard clauses to flatten the structure.

best_practices: Provide specific code examples when suggesting improvements to help users understand the exact fix needed
Balance constructive feedback by acknowledging good practices alongside areas for improvement
Organize findings by severity (Critical, Major, Minor) to help prioritize remediation efforts
anti_patterns: Reviewing code without considering the broader context or requirements
Focusing only on style preferences rather than substantive quality or security issues
Providing vague feedback without actionable recommendations

faq.question: Does this skill modify my code?
faq.answer: No, this skill only analyzes code and provides recommendations. It does not write or modify any code files.

faq.question: What programming languages does it support?
faq.answer: The skill works with any programming language. It focuses on general principles of code quality, security, and best practices that apply across languages.

faq.question: Can it review my entire codebase?
faq.answer: Yes, you can paste multiple files or entire code sections. For large codebases, consider reviewing files individually for more detailed analysis.

faq.question: Does it catch all security vulnerabilities?
faq.answer: No security tool catches 100% of vulnerabilities. This skill identifies common patterns but should not replace dedicated security audits or tools.

faq.question: How is this different from linters?
faq.answer: Linters enforce syntax and style rules. This skill provides higher-level feedback on architecture, design patterns, security logic, and maintainability that static tools cannot analyze.

faq.question: Can I use this for legacy code?
faq.answer: Yes, the skill works on any code. Legacy code often has more opportunities for improvement, though context about constraints may be helpful.
